required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

brief_summary.textblock: The investigators have previously found moderately painful massage produces comparable changes in pain sensitivity as a conditioned pain modulation paradigm in healthy participants suggesting shared underlying mechanisms. The researchers aim to extend these findings by understanding the influence of expectation on these findings.

detailed_description.textblock: Massage is a muscle biased intervention individuals seek for pain alleviation; however, the mechanisms of massage are not well established. In this study, the investigators aim to determine the effect of expectations on massage related hypoalgesia. Individuals meeting eligibility criteria and agreeing to participate will attend one session that lasts approximately one hour. A myofascial trigger point (taut band of muscle tissue) will be assessed on the neck of the participant. Next, a baseline assessment of pressure pain threshold will be performed followed by random assignment to one of four study arms.

study_design_info.masking_description: Participants will be masked to the type of instructional set received during the intervention. However, participants will be notified of this upon completion of the study.

primary_outcome.description: A computerized pressure algometer with a 1cm diameter rubber tip will be applied to the web space of the non-dominant foot. Participants are instructed to say "stop" so the stimulus can be terminated when the sensation first transitions from pressure to pain (threshold).

arm_group.arm_group_label: Pain Inducing Massage and Positive Expectation Instructions
arm_group.description: A myofascial trigger point will be assessed in the trapezius muscle and massage applied to this area of the neck. Participants in this arm will receive a positive expectation instructional set followed by a moderately painful massage (pain = 50/100). Massage will be applied for one minute, four times with assessment of pressure pain threshold at the foot between each interval.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Pain Inducing Massage and Negative Expectation Instructions
arm_group.description: A myofascial trigger point will be assessed in the trapezius muscle and massage applied to this area of the neck. Participants in this arm will receive a negative expectation instructional set followed by a moderately painful massage (pain = 50/100). Massage will be applied for one minute, four times with assessment of pressure pain threshold at the foot between each interval.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Pain Free Massage and Positive Expectation Instructions
arm_group.description: A myofascial trigger point will be assessed in the trapezius muscle and massage applied to this area of the neck. Participants in this arm will receive a positive expectation instructional set followed by a pain free massage (pain = 0/100). Massage will be applied for one minute, four times with assessment of pressure pain threshold at the foot between each interval.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Pain Free Massage and Negative Expectation Instructions
arm_group.description: A myofascial trigger point will be assessed in the trapezius muscle and massage applied to this area of the neck. Participants in this arm will receive a negative expectation instructional set followed by a pain free massage (pain = 0/100). Massage will be applied for one minute, four times with assessment of pressure pain threshold at the foot between each interval.

intervention.description: A pain inducing massage (pain intensity = 50/100) will be applied for 60 seconds, 4 times.
intervention.arm_group_label: Pain Inducing Massage and Negative Expectation Instructions
Pain Inducing Massage and Positive Expectation Instructions

intervention.description: A pain free massage (pain intensity = 0/100) will be applied for 60 seconds, 4 times.
intervention.arm_group_label: Pain Free Massage and Negative Expectation Instructions
Pain Free Massage and Positive Expectation Instructions

intervention.description: Participants will be instructed that the massage is effective for some people with neck pain.
intervention.arm_group_label: Pain Free Massage and Positive Expectation Instructions
Pain Inducing Massage and Positive Expectation Instructions

intervention.description: Participants will be instructed that the massage is ineffective for some people with neck pain.
intervention.arm_group_label: Pain Free Massage and Negative Expectation Instructions
Pain Inducing Massage and Negative Expectation Instructions

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Pain Free
Exclusion Criteria:
- non-English speaking
- systemic medical condition known to affect sensation (i.e. diabetes)
- regular use of prescription pain medication to manage pain
- current or history of chronic pain condition
- currently using blood thinning medication
- any blood clotting disorder such as hemophilia
